definition: When you enter a village, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)
surname Sui
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
custom/convention/popular/common/coarse/vulgar/secular

sentences.english: When in Rome, do as the Romans do and take the chance to practice your English skills.
sentences.chinese: 入鄉隨俗，同時利用這個機會來練練你的英語吧。

sentences.english: Follow the customs of the new country you are in, or keep your own customs?
sentences.chinese: 入鄉隨俗還是保留自己國家的習俗？

sentences.english: They assumed that immigrants would quickly adopt the mores of their host societies.
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲，移民會很快入鄉隨俗，向主流社會靠近。

sentences.english: The best way is to not comment, do as the Romans do, as soon as possible into the team.
sentences.chinese: 最好的做法就是不加評論，入鄉隨俗，儘快融入團隊。

sentences.english: Respect other cultures. Try to blend in as much as possible.
sentences.chinese: 尊重當地文化，要入鄉隨俗。

definition: to talk nonsense/nonsense!
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
layman
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
to take sth for granted
having ample food and clothing (idiom); well fed and clothed
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
general/broad/sweeping/lacking in detail/vague
Jyutping, one of the many Cantonese romanization systems/abbr. of 粵語拼音|粤语拼音[Yue4 yu3 Pin1 yin1]
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
unwilling
lit. chicken speaking with duck/fig. talking without communicating/people not understanding each other
to work as a good-time girl/to prostitute oneself
cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
